name: Weyland DGAF
description: Finally opening this up to the community. Looking to keep agendas under 9 and the eco flowing just to be a terror to Runners everywhere.

name: NBN - Primetime Blitz v4
description:
Alright I think I'm done tinkering. Taking this to my first (small) local tournament later tonight. Of course any last minute feedback is always appreciated. I'll post my results as well in the next day or so.

+2 GLC -1 RSVP +2 Popup Window +1 Rototurret -3 Gila Hands -1 Breaking News +2 Character Assassination +2 Subliminal Messaging

name: Kit Yogosaurus R&D Hacker 1.0
description: This deck centers around getting Yog.0 + Dinosaurus up ASAP, using The Personal touch to strengthen it so it can smash past anything, but with a special focus on R&D with Maker's eye and R&D Interface. Femme Fatale and Escher allow for sneaking past things Yog can't handle or Corroder can't break. Sentries are an issue, use Femme to bypass them if at all possible or Escher to push them to the front so you can Code Gate them with Kit. Tinkering can be used in a pinch.

name: Off the grid: Custom Biotics
The Exiled God
description:
Credit for the initial design goes to: http://teamcovenant.com/saetzero/2014/02/10/the-llds-processor-deck-skeleton/

Some of this still isn't quite working - Dinosaurus and Test Run are both mostly wasted; I'm thinking of swapping them for a couple of Tinkerings, since they'll help focus runs around a single, cheap, powerful install.

Also considering swapping a third Mr Li and the Datasucker for a third Faerie and another Diesel or Replicator.

The deck can also struggle around making enough runs - there's only so many times you can re-install everything (although it is a surprisingly high number!). Some R&D interfaces may be called for in order to improve the value of runs...

name: Iceless Earth
description: CCCCombo!

name: Iceless Earth
description: Iceless... Scorched Earth Combo!

description: because everyone is playing Andy

name: Kitrecursion
description: basically everything whats not codegate will be trashed, corroder because of wraparound, omega as backup

name: What man?
description: Just an Atman deck in Anarch since you're using Datasucker x3 already. Usual plays of parasite on smaller ICE, Atman at 2-4 str (I think. I haven't played Katman and I'm not 100% on the str. Comments correcting me are appreciated) and Knights for the Big trouble ICE. Mimic and Corroder for swordsman/early aggression and wraparound respectively. Special order and quality time fill out the INF for draw and tutor effects for Corroder vs wraparound...I.E. every deck now. Lol

name: NBN Tag N Bag - F&L v1.0
description:
2nd revision from original http://thesatelliteuplink.blogspot.co.uk/2013/09/winning-decklists-nbn-tag-bag-and-chaos.html

Untested as yet. Theoretically it's the Meat deck that doesn't care about Plascrete - once you've scored PSF you get to machine gun through the Plascrete and lock them down once you Midseasons. Ability to stay ahead on economy is key.

In this build it's possible I'm missing Melange, which was in the original and turbo-charged your economy. I'm looking at whether -1 Pop-Up and -1 Private Contracts for 2x Melange isn't an improvement.

name: Criminal II
Red Queen attempt v.n
description: Still trying to make a viable RR deck to take to a tournament. At least one that I can play with. As far as some of the deck choices, I still am not very sure I need Levy and Same Old Thing. Please advise & suggest... Thank you

name: Spies Like Us 2.0
description: Cheap runs and rezzing ice all day

name: Professional Thief v5.0
description:
I took out Gorman Drip because I was barely getting any use out of it. I added Kati Jones instead for some "guaranteed" income. I also switched my icebreaker suite around a bit adding 3x Faeries instead of Femme to take place for Garrote when I don't have enough to install it or just as quick and cheap Sentry Breakers.

I'm hoping I like this build because I will likely be using it for some upcoming tournaments. Please share your thoughts.

name: Express Train
description: Lean runs and indexing makers eye combo.

name: Everything benefits
description: The deck was built around the idea that every run should give you another benefit - cards, credits and counters for Datasuckers. Also installing programs from heap gives you some strong card advantage.

name: Gotta Go Fast
description:
Sonic's the name, speed's the game.

This is a prototype build based on the fact that making billions of runs with Ken and having the central-only breakers means Quest Completed and Notoriety are easier to score. These are the point of the deck, I'm not going to cut them.

For breaking into remotes, the idea would be to bankrupt the corp through a combination of Account Siphon and Running Interference, then only running them if they can't pay to rez or if the ice is Femme'd. Or, y'know, Quest Completed.

Feedback is appreciated!

name: Katman Test
Ken Goes To Town
description: Run, you clever boy, and remember... Run. Money shouldn't be too much of an issue, the PVP's have 20 targets and half of those make their own money. Breakers are the big issue, but special order should be able to find the one you need. Hit fast and hit hard.

name: Kit Yogosaurus R&D Hacker 1.1
description:
This deck centers around getting Yog.0 + Dinosaurus up ASAP, using The Personal touch to strengthen it so it can smash past anything, but with a special focus on R&D with Maker's eye and R&D Interface. Femme Fatale and Escher allow for sneaking past things Yog can't handle or Battering Ram can't break. Sentries are an issue, use Femme to bypass them if at all possible or Escher to push them to the front so you can Code Gate them with Kit. Tinkering can be used in a pinch.

Possible subs: Battering Ram for Corroder, but requires removing the Datasuckers to make room for influence. Datasuckers could be subbed for Cyberfeeders to make using Femme or Battering Ram less painful.

Built using 1 core set, hence why there's only 2 Yog.0 and 2 Femme.
